Q_DESC:
The balance B of a savings account after t years when a principal P is invested at an annual interest rate r and the interest is compounded yearly is given by: B=P*(1+r/100)^n. Suppose $5,000 is invested for 17 years in one account where the interest is compounded yearly. The interest rate is 8.5%. Use MATLAB to determine the balance after 17 years. The input format is:
Enter the Principal amount:Enter the Rate of interest(in %):Enter the no.of years:
